snippet: Several young authors of financial advice books say they were taught at an early age to be mindful about money.
abstract: Ron Lieber Your Money column describes the childhoods of financial gurus Zac Bissonnette, Ramit Sethi, Lauren Lyons Cole and Brittney Castro; notes that each author was taught at an early age to be mindful about money. Photos (M)
lead_paragraph: Though only a third of 2012 has passed, Zac Bissonnette is already a strong contender for the cheekiest author of the year award. His new book, ''How to Be Richer, Smarter, and Better-Looking Than Your Parents,'' is filled with reasonable advice about debt and savings for young adults. But the 23-year-old author -- this is his second book that the Portfolio imprint of Penguin has published -- also compares financial services professionals to rapists and says that big, national banks are run by morons.

headline.main: How To Raise A Financial Guru
